S.TRANSL: On this day 22 years ago, the term "shanbao" (mountain people) in the Additional Articles of our Constitution was replaced with the proper name: "indigenous people".
S.FORM: tucu a qadaw ka sika 22 a cavilj a pitjaisangas, auza "sanpaw" aya vecik itua tja kimpu, pinavalitan anga tua "yuncuming" aya tja kangadanan.

S.TRANSL: This correction not only did away with a discriminatory term, but also highlighted the status of indigenous peoples as Taiwan's "original owners".
S.FORM: aicu a pinavalitan a seman kangadanan, inika amin a semualap tua pinakacuan ta sinisan paqeteleng a papungadan, pakeljang anga uta tu avan a kacalisiyan a "kaqulidan a kaimazan i taiwan a caucau".

S.TRANSL: From this basis, today, we are taking another step forward.
S.FORM: tucu a qadaw, tjakasimazai a temagilj a pacun, sa tja patjaljiaqayaw anga itjen tu tadjekuacan.

S.TRANSL: To all indigenous peoples of Taiwan: On behalf of the government, I express to you our deepest apology.
S.FORM: uri kitjauvalit aken tua siihu, a pasemalaw tua tjaljavavavan a kipaqaljai tua kakazuku anga a kacalisiyan a mapuljat.

S.TRANSL: For the four centuries of pain and mistreatment you have endured, I apologize to you on behalf of the government.
S.FORM: uri sevalit aken tua siihu, a kipaqaljai a pudjavadjavai tjanumun a mapuljat, itua sitjaisangasan a 400 a cavilj, a masa nu kipaula kata inika pinapapamamavan a kilalaing tjanumun.

S.TRANSL: I know that even now, there are some around us who see no need to apologize.
S.FORM: masalu aken, kumalji a patje tucu, ita tja kinatevteveljan, izuanan a kimapida a caucau a kinemnemnem tu sikuda a pudjavadjavai ayaya.

S.TRANSL: But that is the most important reason why I am representing the government to issue this apology today.
S.FORM: saka avan aicu, a uri ku sitjaljumaza tucu a qadaw a kitjauvalit tua siihu a pudjavadjavai a kipaqaljai.

S.TRANSL: To see what was unfair in the past as a matter of course, or to treat the pain of other ethnic peoples as an unavoidable part of human development, this is the first mindset that we, standing here today, resolve to change and overturn.
S.FORM: saka a patjara inika pinapapamamavan, kata kinipaulan nua zuma zuku kasicuayan, izua sakamayan a namatazua itua pinasasevalivalitan nua caucau ayaya a sipacunan, avan a tja sinika imaza a nasaljinga tu pavalit tu mumalj a semangas.

S.TRANSL: Let me put in simple terms why we are apologizing to the indigenous peoples.
S.FORM: pai ku madjuludjuluaw a ku kai a qivu, a pasemalaw tuki anema patarevan nua pudjavadjavai tua kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: Four hundred years ago, there were already people living in Taiwan.
S.FORM: aicu a kadjunangan i taiwan, pitjaisangas tua 400 a cavilj izuanga a caucau a kaimazan.

S.TRANSL: These first inhabitants lived their lives and had their own languages, cultures, customs, and domains.
S.FORM: aicu a marka caucau imaza izua niamadju angata a sikacu, a kai, a bungka, a kakudanan, a sikavaljuljutan.

S.TRANSL: But then, without their consent, another group of people arrived on these shores, and in the course of history, took everything from the first inhabitants who, on the land they have known most intimately, became displaced, foreign, non-mainstream, and marginalized.
S.FORM: pitjavililjanga, manu izua a taciuran a caucau inika pinusaluan, sa pangtjez a semamaza taicu a kadjunangan.

S.TRANSL: The success of one ethnic people can be built on the suffering of another.
S.FORM: saka itua nacemalivat a likisi, aicu a tjaivililj a nakitevalj a caucau, qavan anga tua nanemanemanga a penuljat a kaimazan a caucau.

S.TRANSL: Unless we deny that we are a country of justice, we must face up to this history.
S.FORM: pai sapakalivui anga a penulingelingetj tiamadju a kemasi tua kinatavakan a kadjunangan, saka masan tjeqaljaqalja anga caucau, ini anga ka tiamadju a malailaing, sinantailj anga a caucau tiamadju.

S.TRANSL: We must tell the truth.
S.FORM: a namirazek a kinakunian, palemek tu liningedjelj a pitua siselapai nua zuma nu zukuan.

S.TRANSL: And then, most importantly, the government must genuinely reflect on this past.
S.FORM: nu uri kipasemalaw tjen tu kananguaqan a tja kukka, tjara tja sanpazangalen aicu a tja pinacalivat a likisi, sa tja pasemalavan a paquliqulid a kinakemudamudan.

S.TRANSL: This is why I stand here today.
S.FORM: saka nakuya inika kemasi varung a siihu a kipalikuz tua namayatucu a pinacalivat katjaisangas, pai avan aicu a ku sinikalingdjelj tucu a qadaw i maza.

S.TRANSL: There is a book called "The General History of Taiwan" published in 1920.
S.FORM: izua ita sapitj a pinaka "taiwantungse".

S.TRANSL: In its foreword are these words: "Taiwan had no history.
S.FORM: ita sangasangasan a kai a takalan, napatjanema a "neka nu likisi na se taiwan.

S.TRANSL: The Dutch pioneered it, the Koxinga Kingdom built it, and the Qing Empire managed it.
S.FORM: se hullanda a caucau a na patagilj, lja ceng a caucau a nakipusengsengan, pinaljavakan na cingtai a nakilalaing," aya.

S.TRANSL: This is a typical Han view of history.
S.FORM: aicu a kai, makeljang aravac tu sikinemneman nua pairang a caucau.

S.TRANSL: The truth is that indigenous peoples have been here for thousands of years, with rich culture and wisdom that have been passed down through generations.
S.FORM: a kakazuku a kacalisiyan, ka pida kuzulj a cavilj a pitjaisangas, imaza anga tusa kadjunangan, izuanga a martimaljimalji a natemalidu a bungka kata puvarungan, saka pazuruzurung a pinasasevalivalitan anga.

S.TRANSL: But we only know to write history from the perspective of the dominant.
S.FORM: ljakua, a tja sivecikan tua likisi, tja sinikilaing tua tjapupicul a naqemizing a zuku.

S.TRANSL: For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.
S.FORM: pai masa mavan aicu, tjalju maza ken a kitjauvalit tua siihu a pudjavadjavai tua kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: The Dutch and the Koxinga Kingdom massacred and exploited the Pingpu ethnic group.
S.FORM: a sivitai na hullanda kata pinaljavakan ni ceng-ceng- kung napapacai tua tjuruvu a pingpu zuku a caucau, sa qavi tiamadju tua sikavaljualjut.

S.TRANSL: The Qing Empire presided over bloody confrontations and suppression.
S.FORM: a pinaljavakan na cingcau izua kudral aravac a maqaqeciqeci kata paselapai.

S.TRANSL: Colonial Japan put in place comprehensive savage policies.
S.FORM: a pinaljavakan nua zipun na penulinglingetj a kemaljaqulidan angata a pavalit a seman caucau niamadju, patja tucu a pitjaivililj anga tua maqaqeci.

S.TRANSL: And the post- war ROC government undertook assimilation policies.
S.FORM: kamayan a cunghuaminku a puri seman pairang ta kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: For 400 years, every regime that has come to Taiwan has brutally violated the rights of indigenous peoples through armed invasion and land seizure.
S.FORM: aicu a 400 a cavilj, a nasemamaza anga i taiwan a paljavak a marka siihu, nasema picul a lemivu, naqemav tua kadjunangan, a semavuta a papeneka tua kaniamadjuan a manguaqan a kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.
S.FORM: pai masa mavan aicu, tjalju maza ken a kitjauvalit tua siihu a pudjavadjavai tua kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: Indigenous peoples maintain tribal order according to traditional customs, and ecological balance according to traditional wisdom.
S.FORM: a kacalisiyan sikilailaing tua kakudan a pakaizua tua marasudjan nua taqaljaqaljan, saka izua kemasi sicuayan a puvarungan madjadjalu katua nanemanemangan i kacauan.

S.TRANSL: But in the process of modern state-building, indigenous peoples lost the right to steer their own course and govern their own affairs.
S.FORM: ljakua, tucu a liningedjelj a venaquan a kakudanan nua kukka, neka anga nu picul nua kacalisiyan a kisumadju a kipenetj tua patjara niamadju a sengsengan, neka anga nu picul a kisumadju a kilalaing tua taqaljaqaljan.

S.TRANSL: The fabric of traditional societies was torn apart, and the collective rights of peoples were not recognized.
S.FORM: namaceperak anga sicuayan a sirasudjan ta qinaljan, sa inika sinumavan tiamadju na vaquan a pinaka minsiu a sirasudjan.

S.TRANSL: For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.
S.FORM: pai masa mavan aicu, tjalju maza ken a kitjauvalit tua siihu a pudjavadjavai tua kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: Indigenous peoples had their own languages.
S.FORM: a kacalisiyan tjara izuazua a kai niamadju a paqulid.

S.TRANSL: However, with Japanese rule aiming to assimilate and turn all into imperial subjects, and with the ROC government banning tribal languages after 1945, indigenous peoples' languages suffered great losses.
S.FORM: ka cemalivat tu zipun a napaljavak a pinnetj tu masa kipalaing tu pavalit a seman caucau niamadju; ka pitjaivililj ta 1945 a cavilj, ljemaini anga a siihu a qivu tua kai a kinacalisian, avan a sika patjaseqazaqazalj anga a maulaw na kai nua kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: Most Pingpu languages have disappeared.
S.FORM: pai sa namaqulip anga a mareka kai nua se pingpu zuku.

S.TRANSL: Successive governments have been negligent in the protection of indigenous cultures.
S.FORM: a namasasevalivalit a siihu, inika nakisasusu tua kakudan tua bungka nua kacalisiyan,

S.TRANSL: For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.
S.FORM: pai masa mavan aicu, tjalju maza ken a kitjauvalit tua siihu a pudjavadjavai tua kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: Without the knowledge of the Yami tribe, the government stored nuclear waste on Orchid Island.
S.FORM: pai tazua cavilj, ka inika kemljakeljang a yami zuku, pasazuain i lanyu na siihu azua paljiq na dingki.

S.TRANSL: Tribe members on the island had to suffer the negative consequences.
S.FORM: sa kipaulaula a marka taqaljaqaljan i lanyu.

S.TRANSL: For this, I apologize to the Yami people on behalf of the government.
S.FORM: pai masa mavan aicu, tjalju maza ken a kitjauvalit tua siihu a pudjavadjavai tua yami zuku a caucau.

S.TRANSL: Ever since outsiders began arriving in Taiwan, the Pingpu ethnic group on the western plains have born the brunt of the impact.
S.FORM: ka patagilj a saqumaqanen a i taiwan nua kasicasaw a zuma a caucau, avan a i kazatjazatja i pasakaledep a pingpu zuku a sangasan a kicevungan.

S.TRANSL: One ruling power after another eroded the individual and collective identities of the Pingpu ethnic group.
S.FORM: a namasasevalivalit anga a nazemang, qinulip anga a ngadan nua caucau kata kinazukuan nua se pingpu.

S.TRANSL: For this, I apologize to the Pingpu ethnic group on behalf of the government.
S.FORM: pai masa mavan aicu, tjalju maza ken a kitjauvalit tua siihu a pudjavadjavai tua pingpu zuku.

S.TRANSL: After the democratic transition, the country began to respond to the appeals of indigenous movements.
S.FORM: a pitjaivililj tua kinamapavalitan a masan minsiu, natemvela a kukka tua kiqaung nua kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: The government made certain promises and efforts.
S.FORM: sa izua siniljaui nua siihu, izua anga uta kinisamuljan a kedri.

S.TRANSL: Today, we have an Indigenous Peoples Basic Law that is quite advanced.
S.FORM: tucu a qadaw, izua anga a namasan qapulu hulic na kacalisiyan a pinaka yuncumin cipenva.

S.TRANSL: However, government agencies have not given sufficient weight to this law.
S.FORM: ljakua, aicu a hulic, inika sinan pazangal nua marka kisasusususu itua siihu.

S.TRANSL: Our actions have not been fast enough, comprehensive enough or sound enough.
S.FORM: gemalju anga a lingedjeljen, inika namakakaizuazua, inika namaqacuvung.

S.TRANSL: For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.
S.FORM: pai masa mavan aicu, tjalju maza ken a kitjauvalit tua siihu a pudjavadjavai tua kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: Taiwan is known as a culturally diverse society.
S.FORM: aicu a i taiwan pinaka kinatevteveljan a siakai nua namapakakaizuazua a bungka.

S.TRANSL: But even today, indicators on health, education, economic livelihood, political participation and more still show gaps between indigenous and non- indigenous peoples.
S.FORM: ljakua, patje tucu a qadaw, aicu a pitua tarivakan na kinacavacavan, pitua sikituluan, pitua sikavaljualjut a kizai, a pitua sikicapiljan tua siizi na kacalisiyan, namacacadja anan aravac katua inika kacalisiyan a caucau i taiwan.

S.TRANSL: Meanwhile, stereotypes and even discrimination against indigenous peoples have not gone away.
S.FORM: a sipacunan a seman kacalisiyan, a sisanpavalan, kamayan a izua a patje tucu.

S.TRANSL: The government has not done enough, so indigenous peoples have suffered pain and frustration unknown to other ethnic peoples.
S.FORM: Inika namadjaljun a kinudanan nua siihu, avan nu sika nacemavulid sakamayan a kacalisiyan tua siselapai kata kipaula a inika kinljang nua pairang.

S.TRANSL: For this, I apologize to the indigenous peoples on behalf of the government.
S.FORM: pai masa mavan aicu, tjalju maza ken a kitjauvalit tua siihu a pudjavadjavai tua kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: Our efforts have fallen short, and succeeding generations have been blind to this inadequacy.
S.FORM: inika qacuvung a kisamulja na siihu, saka inika nakemljang a kirimu a siihu tu inika qacuvung a kisamulja.

S.TRANSL: Because of this, your hardship has continued to this day.
S.FORM: avan a sika kamayan a nu siselapai a patje tucu.

S.TRANSL: For this we are truly sorry.
S.FORM: djavadjavai a paqulid.

S.TRANSL: Today's apology is long overdue, but it is a beginning.
S.FORM: a ku pudjavadjavai tucu a qadaw, ui tu gemalju anga aravac, ljakua ki namasan patagilj aicu.

S.TRANSL: I do not expect any one speech or phrase of apology to wipe away four centuries of pain and suffering by the indigenous peoples.
S.FORM: Inika ken a nakikaljava tu uri masa mavan aicu a pinuitan a vincikan, a kai a pudjavadjavai, saka uri masan neka anga a nu cinavulid a kipaula a nu piqai i varung a kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: But I do hope with all my heart that today's apology will set this country and all its people on the path towards reconciliation.
S.FORM: ljakua, nasaljinga aken a paqulid, tu aicu a ku pudjavadjavai tucu a qadaw, uri maqati a masan tagilj nua madjadjaludjalu na taqaljaqaljan a mapuljat i maza itua tja kuni.

S.TRANSL: Please allow me to shed light on this occasion with a piece of indigenous wisdom.
S.FORM: uri paka tua caquan aken nua kacalisiyan, a pasemalaw tua tja kinatevteveljan tucu a qadaw.

S.TRANSL: In the Atayal language, truth is called "Balay", and reconciliation is called "Sbalay", so you simply add an "S" sound to "Balay".
S.FORM: a kai nua se tayal zuku, "balay" aya tua kaqulidan, sbalay aya qivu tua maljaljenguanguaq", nu pazuljuan a balay a pitjaiqayaw tua s a vicik.

S.TRANSL: Truth and reconciliation are in fact two related concepts.
S.FORM: a kaqulidan kata madjadjalu, izua kakacapilj a mamaw.

S.TRANSL: In other words, only by facing the truth sincerely can reconciliation be attained.
S.FORM: nu tja siumalj a qivu, a kaqulidan a madjadjaludjalu, amin nu nakemasi varung itjen a kiljaqulid a kemljang tua kaqulidan a tja pinacalivat, mavan a uri namaqacuvung.

S.TRANSL: In indigenous cultures, when a tribe member has offended another and intends to reconcile, an elder brings together the offender and the offended not to produce a direct apology, but to allow each side to frankly share their inner journeys.
S.FORM: itua kakudan nua kacalisiyan, nu izua sepasaliw tua zuma caucau i qinaljan, saka nasaljinga tua kidjadjaluan, papecevungen nua vuluvulung azua napasaliw kata pinasalivan a caucau, nu maqepu anga tiamadju, a inika avan a pudjavadjavai ta kai a sisangas, avan a kemasi varung a macidicidilj a caucau, sa pasemalaw tua pinacalivat a kipaula niamadju.

S.TRANSL: When this truth-telling concludes, the elder calls for everyone to drink together, so that what is past is truly past.
S.FORM: nu napasemalaw anga tua paquliqulid a pinacalivatan, pai malap anga a vuluvulung tua i kuppu sa kitekel anga tua timaimangan, pai a sicuayan anga, pacalivaten anga a paqulid.

S.TRANSL: This is "Sbalay".
S.FORM: aicu avan a paqulid a pinaka sbalay.

S.TRANSL: I hope today's occasion can be a "Sbalay" between the government and the indigenous peoples.
S.FORM: a ku kikaljava tua tja kinatevteveljan tucu a qadaw, mavan a sbalay nua siihu kata kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: I have spoken of past mistakes and truths the best I can, with nothing held back.
S.FORM: napapuljat aken tua ku picul, tua ku kinljang a pasemalaw tua pinasalisalivan nua siihu ka tjaisangas.

S.TRANSL: In a moment, our indigenous friends will speak.
S.FORM: nu sauni tjara pasemalaw a tja qali a kacalisiyan tua vinarungan niamadju.

S.TRANSL: I do not dare ask you to forgive, here and now.
S.FORM: inika ken a temuru a qiqaung tua nu sipazekatj tucu i maza.

S.TRANSL: But I sincerely ask you to sustain the hope that past wrongs will not be repeated, and that one day, this country can see true reconciliation.
S.FORM: ljakua, kiqaung aken tjanumun tu naseman puzangalan mun, tu tjara ini anga ka uri mumalj a mapacun a mamaw a pinasalivan ka sicuayan, saka aicu a tja kukka, tjara izua tu ita a qadaw, tu maqati a kemaljaqulidan a madjadjaludjalu.

S.TRANSL: Today is only a beginning.
S.FORM: tucu a qadaw namasan tagilj sakamaya.

S.TRANSL: The duty for reconciliation lies not with the indigenous peoples and the Pingpu ethnic group, but with the government.
S.FORM: a pusikining tua madjadjaludjalu inika kacalisiyan katua pingpu a caucau, avan a siihu.

S.TRANSL: I know that words of apology alone are not enough.
S.FORM: kemljang aken tu inika qacuvung a sema kai sakamaya a pudjavadjavai.

S.TRANSL: What we actually do for the indigenous peoples will decide whether reconciliation succeeds or stumbles.
S.FORM: amin a sinan sengsengan a pitjaivililj na siihu a masa kacalisiyan, avan a uri sikakeljang tu uri madjadjaludjalu a tja kukka a paqulid tuki ini.

S.TRANSL: Therefore, I am here to announce that we are setting up an Indigenous Historical Justice and Transitional Justice Commission under the Presidential Office.
S.FORM: uri tjaljumaza ken a pasemalaw, a i tua ku kinaizuanan a cungtungvu, uri pakaizua ken tua "kinateveteveljan a kisan ljemenguaq a pacikel tua namapaqulid a likisi kata kisan pacikel tua kamanguaq a paqulid nua marka kacalisiyan".

S.TRANSL: As the head of state, I will serve as convener and work hand in hand with tribal representatives to pursue historical justice.
S.FORM: uri pakatua ngadan aken nua tjaljavavavan malailaing nua tja kuni, a kisan vuluvulung taicu a kinateveteveljan.

S.TRANSL: We will also discuss, on the basis of equality, the future policy direction of this country.
S.FORM: sa ku kisaseljang tua sinkauljan nua kakazuku a caucau, a kisamulja paseljenguaq tua likisi, a napapamamaw uta a marasudj tua uri kisamuljain a pitjaivililj naicu a kukka.

S.TRANSL: I want to stress that this commission places the greatest importance on equality between the country and the indigenous peoples.
S.FORM: uri paljaluay aken tu, a tjaljavavavan tua sinan pazangal nua kinateveteveljan itua cungtungvu, avan a papamamaw tua qiniladjan nua kacalisiyan kata kukka.

S.TRANSL: The election of tribal representatives, including for the Pingpu ethnic group, will take as basis the consensus of peoples and tribes.
S.FORM: a pinaparangezan nua kakazuku, a patjelja pingpu zuku, tjara mavan a rasurasudjan nua taqinaljanan a uri kasizuanan.

S.TRANSL: This commission will serve as a mechanism for collective decision-making by indigenous peoples, and will ensure that the voices of tribe members find true expression.
S.FORM: aicu a sinan djalan, uri masan tineveteveljan anga tua vinarungan nua kakazuku a kacalisiyan, saka uri masan kakasizuan a kemljang tua varung nua kacalisiyan a mapuljat.

S.TRANSL: In addition, I will request that our Executive Yuan convene regularly the Indigenous Peoples Basic Law Promotion Committee, and use the Yuan's authority to coordinate and handle matters related to any consensus reached by the above-mentioned commission.
S.FORM: izua zuma anga, uri pazazekatj aken tua sincenyun tu pennetj a pakaizua tua "kinateveteveljan nua kisan papezangal tua namasan qapulu a kakudan na kacalisiyan." pai azua pinaka izua a sengsengan imaza, uri mavan anga a pasusuan nua siihu, sa masan kasizuangan nua tjaljavavavan a kinatevteveljan nu marasudj a kipusengsengan tua sengsengan nua kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: These matters include the following: to retrieve historical memories, to promote indigenous self-government, to seek fair economic development, to ensure continuation of culture and education, to safeguard indigenous health, and to protect the rights of urban indigenous peoples, etc.
S.FORM: pai aicu a sengesengan izua pakatua kipakim a pacekel tua likisi, papirazek tua kisumadju a zemang tua qinaljan a kacalisiyan, papamamaw a kisaseljang tua kizai, sikituluan kata pazurung a bungka, paljakev ta nasuljivatj a kinacavacavan, kata paljakev ta manguaqan nua i pairairang anga a kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: Where modern laws and indigenous traditional cultures are at odds, we will set up an Indigenous Legal Service Center with a high degree of cultural sensitivity, to reduce through institutional design the growing clashes between indigenous customs and modern laws.
S.FORM: nu izua sikamartimaljian nua kakudan na kacalisiyan katua situcuan a hulic, uri pazazekatj aken tua sincenyun tu pakaizua tua "kinateveteveljan a kisan pusaladj tua kacalisiyan a pakatua hulic", sa pakatua nanguaq a rasudjan a papekedri tua macacugecug katua rivurivuan nua siihu katua kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: I will ask the relevant agencies to immediately pull together cases in which indigenous community members have been indicted or sentenced for hunting, where the hunting was done in accordance with traditional customs, on traditional lands, and for non-transactional needs, and where the animals hunted were not protected by conservation laws.
S.FORM: tjara men a pazazekatj tua izua a kipusengsengsengan itua siihu tu pakirimu a seman vecik tua patjara kakudan nua kacalisiyan a qemaljup tua inika sinikaqilji nua hulic a qemuziquzip, sa djameqi tiamadju a seman pasaliw a remusung.

S.TRANSL: For such cases we will deliberate solutions.
S.FORM: aicu a namayatucu, tjara men a kinemenem tua sikamasuqadjayan a djalan.

S.TRANSL: I will also direct relevant agencies to present an investigative report on the decision-making process of nuclear waste storage on Orchid Island.
S.FORM: uri pazazekatj aken tua marka kicapicapilj, tu pasemalaw tu namakuda angata a pinnetjan a seman papadjengan ta paljiq na dingki tua i lanyu.

S.TRANSL: Before finding a permanent solution for the nuclear waste, we will provide the Yami tribe appropriate compensation.
S.FORM: sa pavai a siihu tua nasedjaljep a valet tua yami zuku, a pitjaisangas tua semualap taicu a paljiq izua.

S.TRANSL: At the same time, under the principle of respecting the Pingpu ethnic group's self- identity, and recognizing their identity, we will examine relevant laws before September 30 of this year, so that Pingpu ethnic group identity will receive the rights and status it deserves.
S.FORM: pai tucu, masa tja paseljang tua kisanpazangal a kimadju nua pingpu zuku katua kipakeljang tua kinaqatian niamadju, pai a pitjaisangas tua sika 30 a qadaw nusika 9 qiljas tucu a cavilj, uri maljavar a siihu tu pinnetj ta hulic, saka maqati a mapacikel a niamadju angata a kamanguaq katua kinapingpu zukuan.

S.TRANSL: On November 1 of this year, we will begin to delineate and announce indigenous traditional territories and lands.
S.FORM: nu sika 1 a qadaw tua sika 11 qiljas tucu a cavilj, uri puvecik amen a pukeljang, sa nia pasemalaw tua patje inuinu angata a kadjunangan nua kacalisiyan a kemasicuai.

S.TRANSL: The system of tribal public corporation is already in place.
S.FORM: papezangazangal anga men tu masan huzing itua hulic a taqinaljanaljanan,

S.TRANSL: In the future, the ideals of indigenous self-government will be realized step by step.
S.FORM: saka nu tjaivililj, a saljingan tu kisumadju a paljavak na kacalisiyan, tjara mapasusu a maitaita.

S.TRANSL: We will step up the pace and submit for legislative deliberation three laws of great importance to indigenous peoples: the Indigenous Peoples Self-Government Law, the Indigenous Peoples Land and Sea Areas Law, and the Indigenous Languages Development Law.
S.FORM: uri papedjaljaw amen tua nia sidjekuacan, sa nia satjezi a kirimu a pasa tua lip-pu-ing a sinanpazangal aravac na kacalisiyan a "vecik tua sipaljavakan a kisumadju na kacalisiyan", "vecik tua kadjunangan katua ljavek na kacalisiyan", "vecik tua sipapirazekan tua kai na kacalisiyan", sa lingdjelji a seman hulic.

S.TRANSL: Later this afternoon, we will convene a national indigenous peoples administrative meeting.
S.FORM: nu masukecengelj tucu a qadaw, uri kaigi amen tua patjara sengsengan nua kakazuku a kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: In that meeting, the government will elaborate on the policies.
S.FORM: i maza ita kakaigian, uri masan tjaliaw aravac a pasemalaw tua uri kipusengsenganen nua siihu.

S.TRANSL: On every August 1 to come, the Executive Yuan will report to the indigenous peoples our progress on restoring historical justice and transitional justice.
S.FORM: a pitjaivililj, nu djemaljun a sika 1 a qadaw tua sika 8 a qiljas a ljemita tu cavilj, tjara pasemalaw a sing- ceng-yun tu patje inuinu anga a kinipusengsengan tua patjara paseljenguaq tua likisi kata pasata manguaqan nua marka kacalisiyan.

S.TRANSL: To implement the Indigenous Peoples Basic Law, to serve indigenous historical justice, and to lay the foundation for indigenous self- government – these are the three major goals for the government's policy towards indigenous peoples.
S.FORM: saka aicu a kemalja pacikelan tua kaqulidan a likisi na kacalisiyan, a patjara pakaizua tua kisumadju a remasudj na kacalisiyan, avan a masantjelulj a pinnetj nua siihu tu kakisamuljain a padjaljun.

S.TRANSL: To all of our indigenous friends here and watching on TV and online: I invite you to stand witness.
S.FORM: a marka kacalisiyan, a i maza, a pacucun tua tilivi katua itelnik a taqaljaqaljan a marka ku qalialian a kacalisiyan a mapuljat, pai timunai a kisan rupasekeljakeljang.

S.TRANSL: I invite you not to endorse, but to oversee.
S.FORM: a nu sinika i maza, ku djinaulj mun tu pusaladj a zemazaw, inika mavan a uri husiiu.

S.TRANSL: Please keep pressure on the government and right its course where necessary, so that it will realize its commitments and right historical wrongs.
S.FORM: timun a marka ku sikataqaljan zangalu a pakipapaulingaw, a temulu, ulja namakapasusu a siihu tua sinikieces, sa kiumalj a paqulid tua sicuayan a pasalisaliw.

S.TRANSL: I want to thank all of our indigenous friends.
S.FORM: masalu aken tua marka ku qali a kacalisiyan a mapuljat

S.TRANSL: You remind everyone in this country that there is irreplaceable value in the land we tread on and the traditions we inherit.
S.FORM: timun a napakipapaulingaw tua caucau a mapuljat i itua tja kukka, a nu djekap taicu a kadjunangan, kata nu kakudanan a kemasi sicuayan, inika maqati a pasevalitan tua nanemanga.

S.TRANSL: This value deserves dignity.
S.FORM: a kinamasan pazangal naicu a penuljat, nakuya tjara tjasan tjaljavavavan a paqulid.

S.TRANSL: In the future, we will push for policies to ensure that succeeding generations of indigenous tribes and all ethnic peoples in Taiwan never lose their languages and memories, that they are never separated from their cultural traditions, and that never again are they lost in a land of their own.
S.FORM: nu tjaivililj, tjara men a pakatua seman sengsengan na siihu a zemurung ta kakudanan na kacalisiyan, saka a tjaivilivililj anga nua kacalisiyan, a namasasevalivalit anga a kacalisiyan, kata kakazuku anga a mapuljat imaza ita kadjunangan i taiwan, sa inianga kamasukai, inianga ka uri masupaqenetjan, sa ini angaka uri seqalja a kacalisiyan tua kakudanan niamadju, ini anga uri seljaljiak itua kadjunangan niamadju.

S.TRANSL: I call upon our entire society to come together and get to know our history, get to know our land, and get to know the cultures of our many ethnic peoples.
S.FORM: kiqaung aken tu meseljaseljang a kisamulja a mapuljat, tjakeljangaw a tja likisi, tjakeljangaw a tja kadjunangan, tjakeljangaw uta a martimaljimalji a tja kakudan a kakazuku.

S.TRANSL: Let us work towards reconciliation, a shared existence and shared prosperity, and a new future for Taiwan.
S.FORM: sa tje pasa tua namadjadjaludjalu, pasa tua mamamaw a tja kinavaljutan kata tja kinamirazekan, a pasa tua vaquan a tja djalan a taiwan nu tjaivililj.

S.TRANSL: I call upon all citizens to seize the opportunities offered by this day – to join together, work hard, and build a country of justice, a country of true diversity and equality.
S.FORM: kiqaung aken tua taqaljaqaljan a mapuljat, kemasi tucu a qadaw, kisamuljai a lemingdjelj tua kananguaqan a kukka, a qulidan a izua namakakaizuazua a kinakemudamudan, saka namapapamamaw a kakudan a kukka.

S.TRANSL: Thank you all
S.FORM: masalu maljimalji a mapuljat
